block.p: Victoria Kathryn Potterton and Austin Levitt Zalkin were married last evening at the Yale Club in New York. Rabbi David M. Posner officiated.
The bride and bridegroom met at Dartmouth, from which they graduated, she magna cum laude and he cum laude.
Victoria Kathryn Potterton and Austin Levitt Zalkin were married last evening at the Yale Club in New York. Rabbi David M. Posner officiated.
Victoria Kathryn Potterton and Austin Levitt Zalkin were married last evening at the Yale Club in New York. Rabbi David M. Posner officiated.
The bride and bridegroom met at Dartmouth, from which they graduated, she magna cum laude and he cum laude.

Mrs. Zalkin, 26, is to graduate from Yale next month with a combined medical and M.B.A. degree. She is the daughter of Kathryn B. Potterton and William H. Potterton of Fairfax, Va. Her father retired as a senior analyst in the financial management group at R. M. Vredenburg, a military contractor in Arlington, Va. Her mother is an executive administrator in the treasury department at Exxon Mobil Corporation in Fairfax.

Mr. Zalkin, 27, works in New York as an associate at ACI Capital, an investment firm, seeking out companies to buy. He is a son of Janet Levitt Zalkin of New York and the late Kenneth G. Zalkin. His mother is a financing adviser for the investment bank iQ Venture Partners in New York. His father was a lawyer specializing in bankruptcy cases at Parker, Duryee, Zunino, Malone & Carter, a New York law firm.
